TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class CollectionBase<T> : System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T>, System.Collections.ICollection where T : class

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CollectionBase`1<class T> extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<!T>, class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public MustInherit Class CollectionBase(Of T) Implements ICollection, IEnumerable(Of T)
generic <typename T> where T : classpublic ref class CollectionBase abstract : System::Collections::Generic::IEnumerable<T>, System::Collections::ICollection

Docs.summary: Creates a generic class for all public generic collections.

remarks.para: This class implements the Microsoft .NET FrameworkIEnumerable generic interface that is required for data binding and iterating collections. This class also implements the .NET FrameworkICollection interface, and provides a Count property.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed
public: virtual void CopyTo(Array ^ array, int index);

Docs.param: One-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the ICollection interface. The array must have zero-based indexing.
Index in the array at which copying begins.
Docs.summary: Copies the internal collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.
Docs.exception: The array is not large enough to hold copied data. The number of elements in the source ICollection interface is greater than the available space from the index to the end of the destination array
Occurs if array is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Occurs if the index is less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Count { get; }
.property instance int32 Count
Public ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the collection.
Docs.value: An integer that represents the number of items in the collection.

remarks.para: If the collection uses data paging, this property returns the count of the current set of paged data.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<T> GetEnumerator ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<!T> GetEnumerator() cil managed
Public Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator(Of T)
public: virtual System::Collections::Generic::IEnumerator<T> ^ GetEnumerator();

Docs.summary: Returns a generic enumerator that can iterate through this generic CollectionBase instance.
Docs.returns: A System.Collections.IEnumerator for iterating this CollectionBase instance.

remarks.para: GetEnumerator is the method that implements the foreach statement (For Each in Visual Basic). You do not need to call this method directly. This method implements the Microsoft .NET FrameworkIEnumerable_T.GetEnumerator method. See the Microsoft .NET Framework SDK for details about the IEnumerable_T.GetEnumerator method.

Public ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean
public: property bool IsSynchronized { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether the collection is synchronized.
Docs.value: true if the access to the collection is synchronized; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: Zero-based index of the item to get.
Docs.summary: Gets the item at the specified .
Docs.exception: is less than zero, or index is equal to or greater than Count.

Docs.summary: Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to this collection.

virtual System::Collections::IEnumerator ^ System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator() = System::Collections::IEnumerable::GetEnumerator;

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator that can iterate through the CollectionBase.
Docs.returns: A T:System.Collections.IEnumerator interface for iterating the CollectionBase.

remarks.para: #GetEnumerator is the method that implements the foreach statement (For Each in Visual Basic). You should not need to call this method directly.
